title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and only took about 20 minutes. Mainly asked questions about scheduling and past experiences that would contribute to their current project. Interview was held virtually over Zoom.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to apply for this position?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They had me join an initial interview, during which they asked me where they should be promoting the job description because they didn't have enough applicants, and asked me to share the JD with my network. I sent them requested writing samples, and then didn't hear anything back for three weeks.
Interview Questions: How did I hear about this position?

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was relatively thorough, but friendly. It was over Zoom, and there were two interviewers. They were both kind and easy to talk to. Overall, not a bad experience.
Interview Questions: How would you accommodate different needs as an RA?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for cornell tech connective media program. Video essay was typical. General questions are asked. The process is quite simple. That’s it. Good luck applying for cornell tech. Love it!
Interview Questions: Dont remember. Why school questions.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Apply for it with resume and your cover letter People will connect you and arrange for a interview Remote online interview was great and peaceful And everything is going well I get the offer in2 months
Interview Questions: It's nothing to worry about

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Talk to a pi, lab rotations, email ahead to get connected, interview for one hour, forward to committee, and then get the offer a few weeks after. It is a committee based environment and reaching out is actually less important
Interview Questions: Research interest, past experience, career plan

title: Quantitative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: make an appointment after a week, and talked about your experience, introduced the current project, future work, if it fit in Zoom. the interview is not hard, like a talking
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in coding

title: Architect Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: At this point in the application process we would like to invite you to record an online video interview in order to augment your application. The interview questions have been prerecorded so that you can complete the interview at your convenience. Please note that this video interview is a required component of the application.
Interview Questions: why do you choose cornell？

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: It was chill. It was an alumni meeting at Starbucks, and it was only some simple questions to ensure I was a normal student. The person is really nice. I also get to ask some questions as well.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose cornell?

title: AEW Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and lots of questions about prior tutoring experience. Interviewers really want to see your passion in tutoring, but are also very upbeat and chill in terms of the questions asked. Overall a 5/5 experience.
Interview Questions: Describe prior experience that you held in tutoring.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Interview feedback is a type of feedback offered to a candidate after they finish interviewing with your company. Giving productive interview feedback can be good for your employer brand and general company reputation. More often than not, interview feedback is given when a candidate did not the job.
Interview Questions: Interview feedback is a type of feedback offered to a candidate after they finish interviewing with your company. Giving productive interview feedback can be good for your employer brand and general company reputation. More often than not, interview feedback is given when a candidate did not the job.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared with evidence based education and work accompolishments. Remember to speak about your pupose for pursing the program of study. First prepare your ideation of concept, big pictue with a sequence of events to support it.
Interview Questions: Q: how did you solve xzt...

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was long, good questions, eager team. A lot of projects described. No test, show previous work. Ask about structure, ask about benefits, ask about reporting structure. Over all pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: Personal Goals, Previous Experience, Why this College

title: Accounts Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their online application, had a 30-minute phone screening with the hiring manager, then attended a 1-hour in-person panel interview, 3-5 references were checked using an online web form (you will need their email addresses), a verbal offer is then extended, background check is performed through a third party, a formal written offer is then signed.
Interview Questions: Standards. Tell me about you. Tell me about a time you've...

title: Director of Communications and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: First, a one-on-one video-call interview with direct manager. Second, a cluster of two-on-one video-call interviews with stakeholders, including direct reports, counterparts at the university's main communications & marketing department, colleagues in lateral roles, and internal clients of the role. Third, on-campus interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you structure communications service for various internal clients? Would you build one communications operation to handle all internal clients or set up a separate communications unit to service each client?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and okay. The interviewers were kind and composed. I connected with the PI of the lab I was applying for and thought I could really grow in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are your strengths

title: Fitness Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cornell University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Indicated interest, met with person in charge of hiring to discuss, end. Discussion covered my interest in being a fitness monitor, my other obligations, and a general overview of the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a fitness monitor?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Easy going experience that really was a comforting yet informative interview. It felt professional and was also a conversation more than just an interview. Good experience and definitely enjoyed it.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Instructional Design Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Video call with two directors. There was a set list of questions that they went through (like a spreadsheet of pre determined questions). The questions were the typical questions about your experience and behavior. Nothing technical or theoretical was asked. The interview took about 1 hour with the last 10 minutes or so open for the interviewee to ask questions
Interview Questions: What do you find challenging?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is very smooth but hear back from HR is very slow. It take almost 2 months still i did not hear back from HR. Process is very slow.
Interview Questions: How postdoc is important for your career

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Introduction firstly, then behavioral questions about why Cornell University, why accountant, and describe a team work process and result.
Then asked question about sponsorship, job details and benefits, and follow up procedures.
Interview Questions:
Why Cornell?

Why accountant?

Describe a team work process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Casual sit down interview where they asked about previous experience dealing with statistics, some relevant psychological concepts and ability to work with a team in a cohesive and productive manner.
Interview Questions: What is your experience utilizing statistical measuring platforms?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: First-round was with the hiring manager (30 mins) Second round was 2 hours with the team. The third round was with HR. Everyone was super nice and the conversation flowed easily. They didn't grill me on any statistics related questions.
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply for this role?
What do you see yourself doing in 5 years? 10 years?
Describe your work experience so far? 
Describe a data project you worked on and how you trouble shooted a problem you faced.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions:
smooth and interesting，very insightful and
 knowledgeable. Activities are also cool…..like it and love it. Wish you all the best and good luck finger crossed love you all go fighting . You can nail it.
Interview Questions: What’s your research interest and what is your plan next

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions:
Went smoothly, Asked typical interview questions 
The process was difficult, multiple interviews
Interviews conducted through zoom
Be prepared and make sure that you practice the interview questions so that you do not forget at the zoom interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior experience relevant to this role

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by two day  on site interview. Offer produced shortly thereafter. Entered contract negotiation with the help of a recruiter hired by the employer. Overall, very good experience; however, salary and benefits not enough for cost of living in New York City.
Interview Questions: My 5 year career goals.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Interview itself was concise but energetic. Enthusiastic interview team of three people met with me on Zoom, and we all introduced ourselves before diving into deeper questions on my past experience and fit for the job.
Interview Questions:
Do you see yourself as a good fit for this role?
What do you want to do on a daily basis during your time here? Where do you foresee your priorities in the role?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I met about 6 faculty members for the interviews. We also had meetings with the director of graduate studies and of the department. I also had opportunities to meet other graduate students and ask them questions about their experience in the department and with their advisor.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: There was a basic survey that needed to be filled out. The survey asked general questions about my experience in computer science, and what classes I took that were relevant to the course.
Interview Questions: What relevant classes have you taken?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: It was only one meeting with PhD student  in which I was asked questions about my resume, skillsets, etc, I got to ask questions at the end as well about the position, expectations, etc
Interview Questions: What is your previous research experience?

title: Managing Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with panel for journals manager position on campus. Last candidate had held the position for a decade or more. Only one interview, with a group of people on the same Zoom call, then decision.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience managing journals.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was generally informal however depending on the program may consist of one or more interviews. It is best to do research in advance and identify potential advisors and labs of interest.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in attending this program?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: After submitted the proposal and finished the application form, I received the video interview link. There was only one behavioral question and lasted one minute. After around one month, I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Why Cornell university and why this major.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, collegial, and efficient. The process was clear and laid out in terms that I could understand. And everything I learned about the process along the way was delivered in a friendly and professional manner. This created an efficient process overall with good feelings along the way.
Interview Questions: Please walk me through your background.

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Only had two "interviews", the whole process was extremely unprofessional and left a bad taste in my mouth. It took weeks to get any kind of response from their HR team.
Interview Questions: What are your previous experiences as a data scientist?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Nine interviews over three days and I found out I wasn’t selected because the Associate Dean emailed me to recommend me for another position in a different department. The hiring manager never reached out.
Interview Questions: What is the largest gift you’ve personally secured?

title: Software Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on time and everyone was courteous and kind.  The questions were standard and not remarkable.  There were behavioral quesitons and experience questions and both were very standard.
Interview Questions: Walk us through your previous experience.

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I was not interviewed. I got this job based on personal connections, during the pandemic. I simply called my former boss and asked them if they were able to hire me.
Interview Questions: What class do you want to teach?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was courteous throughout the whole process and had thoughtful questions prepared for the interview. It was a pleasant conversation, and although I didn't get the position, it was a positive experience overall. I had a lot of respect for the department ever since.
Interview Questions: How does your experience tie in with the mission of this department?

title: Assistant Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The first round interview was by phone with the search committee. The second round interview entailed a campus visit, arriving in time for candidate dinner on the first day, then leaving at the end of the second day after a full day interview.
Interview Questions: Technical expertise and experience, collaboration, communication, problem-solving, and career goals

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was a very laid-back and conversational interview. The PI answered all of my questions about the position and addressed all of my potential concerns. They also followed up in a timely manner and correspondence was convenient.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your time?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: They forgot to send me a schedule and didn’t have anyone to pick me up at the airport when I arrived. It was a fine interview but they had to completely rewrite the day because I wasn’t able to do a presentation since I had no idea
Interview Questions: What would you imagine you’re goals in 30, 60, and 90 days?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good interview, asked me basic IT questions but most of the interview was a culture fit interview. They just want to see if your a good fit. They will ask questions on if you have experience in certain fields too.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with networks before

title: Senior Desktop Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a very long time, multiple interviews and a very slow communication in between interviews. The interviewers were nice folks overall and given the challenging times I understand the delay but it was still hard to wait through the process.
Interview Questions: How would you solve a conflict between your employees.

title: Dining Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Basically started with asking questions about myself, and why I was applying. Moved onto skills and specific work situations. They then asked if I had any questions. It was  a fairly straightforward, regular interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: it was a great experience. online interview with 5-10 questions, self-recording, 1-5 mins long per question. And I waited 2 weeks before getting the offer. make sure you express your interest clearly.
Interview Questions: why Cornell? what are your greatest accomplishments? what do you value most

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: not too bad. interviewed by another student who didn't really know what he was doing so I kind of had to direct the interview which was okay. very casual but somehow they cut a lot of people
Interview Questions: What was my favorite memory from freshman year

title: Investment Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I sent the resume and cover letter to the recruiter.  The recruiter was very dismissive and couldn't explain clearly the recruiting processes clearly.   It seems that they already have a person in mind even before posting the JD.
Interview Questions: Really basic questions on resume and background.

title: Associate Director, Donor Participation, College Partnerships Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial screening with the Hiring Manager. It lasted about an hour and was pretty laid-back and informative. I then moved on to the second part of the interview process which was six meetings with 20 people over the course of an entire day. I appreciated the opportunity to meet all of the individuals I would have worked with. Everybody was very friendly and engaged in the hiring process. They made me feel welcome as well. The hiring manager spoke with me personally to let me know I had not gotten the job! I will always remember this as a very kind gesture.
Interview Questions: Given the nature of this position, I was asked how went about working with many different types of people.

title: Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and friendly. The interview was mainly about the statement of purpose and the resume.  Make sure to sound genuine and not glib and arrogant. They really emphasize on the interpersonal skills and likeliness of an individual.
Interview Questions:
1) You reason for pursuing graduate studies at sloan?
2) Your background and experience?
3)Cause of your interest?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (Castleton-on-Hudson, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very enjoyable and delightful. They didn't ask too many hard questions and personally, I think they value your passion very much. Should let them know that you are very willing to help students.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable receiving emails from students at your free time?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Emailed faculty with resume and transcript. Then had an in person meeting with them to discuss their work and if it was a good fit. If you receive multiple replies you can pick the group that is right for you.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain as a member of the group?

title: Journals Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Fast interview, and Cornell prof was communicative through the whole process. The staff organized my interview on Zoom, faculty interviewed me. Faculty were interested in my intellectual commitments, editing experience, and supportive of my career journey.
Interview Questions: About my experience editing and managing journals.

title: AMRC Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The process was casual. I was asked some standard behavioral questions. I also was asked about my understanding of the mission of SDS (student disability services) and what I think the job entails.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Why do you want this job?

title: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: There were two phone interviews, one with a recruiter then one with someone at Cornell.   The recruiter interview was more general and the Cornell one was more specific.  Both were very professional.  I felt the recruiter was more open to non-academic experience than the Cornell managers were.
Interview Questions: How many people I supervised.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very fair in my opinion they really wanted to get to know me. Definitely my favorite application process for sure. The staff was so kind and everyone really wanted to see me succeed which is hard to find sometimes
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Applied and got an email in a couple weeks to set up a zoom interview. The zoom interview was 30 minutes in which many questions were asked about past experiences and how that will pertain to this job position and in about a few days I got chosen for a second interview
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past experiences

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: You will need to have done strong research in your undergrad college in order for you to form a competitive application for Cornell University (Ithaca, NY or New York, NY).
Interview Questions: Research aptitude

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cornell University in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process that took two days. I met with many different functional groups and they all asked the same basic questions. None of the groups really u detstood the scope of the position. .
Interview Questions: Basic questions were asked throughout 2 day interview.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Five members hosted the interview over video conference call (Zoom).  It lasted about 45 minutes where most of them asked me about my background and intentions.  Then I had about 10 minutes to ask them questions.
Interview Questions: How would I incorporate engineering/mathematical based theories/equations into my lectures?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Cornell sets you up with travel and a hotel room. You attend several general talks about the program given by professors and current grad students. Then, you typically meet with one or more professors.
Interview Questions: Tell me about research you have been involved with.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: It was quite easy, some common behavioral and situational questions. I applied for an entry level position but was offered a more senior role. The lady who interviewed me was very nice and I had a very positive experience both at the interview and during my work there. It was a great chance to get to know the people at the office.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Describe your past experiences.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The process took four rounds of interviews with a search committee, hiring manager and the department. It took about five months from start to finish but there was constant communication with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with change?

title: BI Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions:
First round: Video interview
Second round: In-person interview, meeting different people in the team
Last round: In-person interview, meeting different stakeholders

The whole process has taken about a month, and the director was very responsive and would keep you updated. Overall pleasant interview experience.
Interview Questions: Walk through the resume, deep-dive questions regarding resume

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Asked a few questions about the experiments. The professor invited me to his office and signed up a few sheets before the interview. Then he started to ask me questions about the role. It is an enjoyable process overall.
Interview Questions: What's your understanding of your roles?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Casual talk about resume. Sat in a room in the IT office and was drilled on everything I put in my resume. Asked general questions related to ongoing products at the IT dept being made.
Interview Questions: General Questions about things on your resume

title: Student Dining Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. Mostly done by other students. Not a  lot of competition. Meet them at the dining hall you are interested in, they make sure you have all your paperwork ready, also give you tour of place and review basic procedures with you.
Interview Questions: When can you start working?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Already knew the professor from class so it was a very informal process and I talked about my interests and availability. We also talked about the projects my professor was working on and what I would be doing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Associate Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a two phaseb one. The first was with the exiting managing editor and the incoming one. The second was with the incomind  editor and a human resources associate. Questions  were targeted toward determining whether the job would be challenging enough to hold my interest.
Interview Questions: How would you handle irate authors

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and helpful. Talked with many professors after being admitted. Have freedom to choose multiple professors as committee members across the campus. Even those are not in the same department are availabe.
Interview Questions: Research interest and future plan

title: Head of Access Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews and a long day of meeting with different groups in their library organization but every interaction was pleasant and every person I met with was kind, supportive, and interested.
Interview Questions: As a manager, how would you support a staff member who did not work the same schedule as you?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Director of TCi interviewed me and tested my knowledge about the program and if I was willing to be a part of it. We spoke on the phone and it lasted around 15-20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Am I okay doing fieldwork

title: Finance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about yourself. Why you are applying and or heard about the position. A little background on the position. The last person might have left or retired. Overall getting through from a senior staff person.
Interview Questions: How you dealt with a difficult team member or person to accomplish a task?

title: Summer Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Geneva, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I haven't an interview because I was enrolled in that program through my University. However, I felt free to email the PI in which lab I was working on and She was so nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do an internship here?

title: Reunion Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, a group interview with 2 or 3 other people. Was placed on the "extras" list for people who didn't initially make it but might be hired if other people couldn't work last minute, which is exactly what happened
Interview Questions: What year would you like to work for and why?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough. It depends on which college you interview with, though. You usually go through panel reviews and then are introduced to your potential peers and given a tour of the university.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you needed to overcome?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cornell University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an in person meeting with the Lab PI and Professor in charge of lab. It was set up via my initial email and sending my CV. The process of the interview also included a tour of the lab space.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work in this lab?
What are you interested in gaining?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: mphasis will be placed on addressing critical market failures limiting the development of the rice, oil palm and horticulture value chains. The project would be seeking to increase agricultural productivity and promoting smallholder commercialization by facilitating private sector investment in selected value chains. It will also strengthen productive links between smallholder farmers and selected agribusiness firms through a business climate lens. Adaptation approaches and mitigation measures will be applied for rice and oil palm production to enhance the climate resiliency of production and to minimize climate risks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Public Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick. They got back to me in about less than a week and I knew that I was hired within two. The people are generally very kind and helpful and seem like they genuinely want you as part of their team.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this role?

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: A bit long, but pretty easy if you have some charisma. I'd say to be yourself in order to get a role in a hall that'll fit you. And be sure to speak up during the group interview rounds.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Fitnes Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: It was quite easy. Make sure you have some sports experience under your belt. Be positive and jovial. Don't take it too seriously. Have some fun with it. They just want to make sure you are nice person to talk to
Interview Questions: Tell me about your biggest strength

title: Hostess Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Went well. No follow up from them .lasted an hour. A lot of questions some personal . Was with the manager and his asst thought we connected but never heard back just saw on website that I was no longer considered
Interview Questions: Do I enjoy living here

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: about 15 minutes. asked typical interview questions and also a lot of hypothetical questions about what you would do in a situation, such as if someone had a printing problem
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had five people in line for questions with varying anger levels?

title: Intellectual Property and Governance Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Job opening was posted on Indeed.com.  Application was via Cornell website.  An attachmemt that was successfully uploaded was either not visible or not forwarded to the manager who conducted the interview, so it had to be emailed to the manager.   The manager emailed me a week after I applied to set up a phone interview, which occurred a few days later.   The phone interview was efficient and included some standard questions amd also some scenarios to test one's skills around time management, delegation, and handling of urgent matters.  Unfortunately, despite the job showing up in search parameters for New York City only, the job was for Cornell's main upstate NY (Ithaca) campus rather than the NYC campus, with no possibility of working at the NYC campus or remotely (though the tasks are a good fit for either).
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online in the fall. Interviewed with HR so it was fairly impersonal and she didn't know too much about the labs. Waiting to hear back if I'll be called in for another interview with PIs.
Interview Questions: Why did you switch labs?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview, then got a face to face interview. Mainly focus on previous projects and tools used. The syllabus for the interviews is very clear and simple. You need get prepared before interview.
Interview Questions: Basic questions on my past experience and skills.

title: Master of Financial Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quicker than I would expect. Basically, you heard questions from videos they had and answer immediately after the interviewer in the video finished. The recording started right after and you need to answer them immediately. The answer only gives you 1 minute to complete.
Interview Questions: Tell us a place where you want to visit the most.

title: Marketing and Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to interview twice. First with a smaller group then did a presentation. Overall, it was a good experience. Lots of interesting people and a very welcoming crowd. Presentation was done with not only those in my department but those departments that we work closely with.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Residential Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Whole day process talking to different staff members and campus partners. For the work that I eventually did, I thought this interview process was overkill. It was not necessary to meet and talk to 18 people for the level of work I did.
Interview Questions: Behavioral/Situational questions

title: House Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: the person interviewing was really nice, it wasn't really an interview though, just more of a meet and greet and would you like to work here thing, and I got to work almost right away because she was just looking for someone
Interview Questions: What times are you willing to work?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was a student at one of the labs. I transitioned into this position in order to complete my project and develop the project into a paper. Hence, my interview was mostly pertaining to my interests and duration of time i'd like to stay with the lab.
Interview Questions: Describe your interests and future direction with your projecy

title: Machinist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview. In person interview 2 weeks later. Tour of facility. Second interview with engineer. Third interview with other employees. Then wait while they interview other candidates.
Interview Questions: Showed me print , asked how I would make the part.

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: UX Designer interview was done in two part, with one with the hiring manager and UX Designer and the second with the team.  I was approached and asked to interview for this position. The position, was later cancelled due to the team not being able to reach a consensus on which candidate to bring onto the team. Unfortunately, this seems to be a common practice as several positions that I was asked to interview on different teams, they ended up canceling the position, because of team conflict during the hiring process of a new team member.
Interview Questions: I requested each team member to name one thing that they would like me to incorporate when working with them on a project.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included me sending in my resume, cover letter, and transcript. The person who interviewed me was great and seemed very welcoming. Fortunately, I had the opportunity to receive the job offer, which I gladly took.
Interview Questions: What made me want to work for the Food and Brand Lab?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Nothing..because I am a former student there. So I dont have a formal interview actually. It's informal and I am a volunteer there. Also, people are really nice there so if you want to do research, please go there
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Stepwise, first send transcripts, letter of intent, recommendation letters (2-3), other documents (toefl, gre,..). Then, Cornell contacts you back if you are pre-selected by a professor for an interview during two days of open-doors. Students can request professors they would like to meet with. Depending on the funding possibilities, as well as the accordance between the students aspirations and the professors opportunities, students are offered a position (M.S or Ph.D).
Interview Questions: Type of research experience, research performed in the past, or research-type interests (organic chemistry? enzyme biology? animal research/surgery? computing/programming?..)

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Cornell's interview process is comprehensive. You start with a friendly phone screen by HR. If you move forward, you are invited onto campus for a day of face-to-face group interviews where you may meet with up to 15 individuals over five hours. These are people that you work with in the department as well a peers across campus.  The final round is between you and another candidate and each of you meet with the Dean.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with a range of personalities?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short and all behavioral. There were no hard questions they just wanted to gauge interested and basic experience. There were two interviewers, one female and one male, and they went back and forth asking questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have reading or working with Blueprints?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: A faculty member from the graduate admissions committee contacted me about the interview after I submitted my application. We setup a time and he called me. After a week or so, I contacted the graduate student staff and I was told I was admitted.
Interview Questions: (1) Past research experiences, (2) Future research interests, and (3) how I see a fit into the Cornell's XXX research lab.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Cordial, phone  interview with principle investigator. Scheduled for 30 minutes, however, ended up being a 60 minute discussion. Program clearly outlined and expectations of Program Director clearly explained.
Interview Questions: My comfort level in presenting educational outreach programs.

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with lab manager to discuss the job, why I believed I was qualified, my strengths and weaknesses, etc. Very positive experience, no curve ball questions and she seemed excited to talk to me about the position.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Library Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, communicate what do you expect and what the employer expect from you; If you can lift 20 pounds; Just the hiring manager asks you questions. I enjoyed the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your working hours?

title: Student Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick and efficient. Questions ranged from customer service experience, technical experience, personal accomplishments, and hypothetical scenarios. More like a quiz than a conversation, questions were rapid and required quick answers.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult situation in a group, whether it be for a project or something else?

title: Web Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the opportunity for the position from asking an instructor for any job opportunities due to my strong javascript skills, and I was offered the position, but had to go through an extensive tutorial and interview process
Interview Questions: What do you know about internet at front end and back end and how do they connect?

title: Reunion Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions about people skills. Want to know why you want to be a clerk. Basically everyone gets the job. I do not know of anybody who did not get the job if they were free for the time period asked. You have to fill out a from and essentially the interview is that form all over again. I did not make it to the group interview but that did not hinder me from getting the job that year.
Interview Questions: What year do you want to work for and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the research assistant position in my junior year. I sent emails to multiple professors in Operations Research and Information Engineering(ORIE) department, and I was accepted by only one professor, whose specialty is queueing theory. He did not even ask me for transcript or GPA, and I got straight into the job and had great fun.
Interview Questions: Which project do you want to work on?

title: Information Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Average
Then typical behavioural interview questions...
- What is the toughest decision you had to make?
- What skills do you think are needed for this role and why?
- What do you like to do outside work?
Interview Questions: describe an event where you had to improve

title: Lead Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Unnecessarily long. Felt like I was applying for upscale restaurant chef position. I had to clean up after the person before me before skills assessment and it counted against me. Horrible experience.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the head of the lab for a while. Basically, he wanted someone with relevant coursework to understand the fundamentals behind the most common techniques we used. I met that basic qualification, so it was a pretty short interview.
Interview Questions: Have you taken the biochemistry lab class.

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very, very long.  From the time I submitted a resume to the time I learned I was not offered the role, more than 7 months had passed.  My on campus interview was very thorough, and exhausting. Dinner, a full day (9 hours of interviews and presentations) and then another dinner concluded the process.  They put a great deal of time, effort, planning, and staff time into preparing for my visit to campus, and everyone was courteous, professional, and engaged. At the end of the process, they selected an internal / interim candidate, which I think they had planned to do all along.  They also did not have the courtesy to contact me to tell me their decision.  I called them a month after my interview only for the hiring manager to tell me that they had already offered the role to the incumbent, and that he had already accepted, weeks earlier.  Fairly common among academic institutions from other experiences.
Interview Questions: Why I had applied for the job.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: After getting admitted by the CEE department, I spoke with 5 faculty, all of whom were very welcoming and shared with me their current research. Also got to meet current grad students, all of which spoke positively about their experiences at Cornell.
Interview Questions: Describe your senior design project. Followed by a lab tour, during which I asked questions about the equipments.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to a specific lab and department that  I wanted to work for. After emailing back and forth several times to ask and answer questions, we scheduled an in-person interview. I met with the PI of the lab and interviewed for an hour. We spoke about general interests, academic and research experiences, discussed research projects I may work on and any projects I had interest in or ideas for, and lastly, we went over behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How have your previous work experiences shaped you?

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and had a group face to face interview. There was four people on the panel, the questions were standard for design - experience, tools used, visual/brand alignment, etc.  Follow up was by the hiring manager. It was a pretty standard interview process.
Interview Questions: Standard questions around years of experience, skills, tools used, etc..

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application, including transcripts, statement of purpose, writing sample, and letters of recommendation. I was contacted by phone informing me that I had been accepted. Prior to this the professor with whom I wanted to work contacted one of my undergraduate advisors to gauge my level of interest in Cornell.
Interview Questions: How interested are you in Cornell?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Sent all the required documents (résumé, cover letter) and scores (TOEFL and GRE). Waited a few months and received an invitation to join the department. Visited them during for the prospective student week-end where I could meet everyone at the department, visit the building and around campus. Everyone was so helpful with visa requirements and such.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied by sending an email to a supervisor.  I was then invited for a 15 minute in person interview with only behavioral questions.  Asked about any work experiences and then just some typical questions that could be expected in any first interview.  Interview concluded quickly and I was offered a job before I left.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: First was a 30 minute phone interview. I was emailed and asked to come meet with the team for a second interview. Second interview was a lot of the same questions I was asked in a phone interview, along with getting to know the team and asking questions( the director of sales asked me a lot of 'off the record, what would I do with a report for 'xyz' "
Interview Questions: How would you handle having to prioritize multiple urgent tasks within a day?

title: Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview had 2 parts- one with the hiring manager and another with the team. Both were fairly standard with questions about experience, how I would handle certain situations and reviewing my portfolio. 

A month later I was asked to complete a 60 minute writing assessment. The assessment itself wasn't difficult but adding the time limit made it more challenging. 

Overall, the time from application to notification took over 3 months.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle situations where you have competing priorities? 
What do you do when you are overloaded with work?
What would you work on if you had the choice?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First Step Phone Screen 1:1
Second round interviews 
Panel of 3 peer level- this was more in line to see how you would "fit" with the team
Panel of 2 mid management-situational questions
Final Round Interviews
Peers- Additional questions regarding your fit and how you handle different situations
Departments you will support- Met with the Administrative directors of the Departments I would support. The Admin directors were very interested in my style of work and how well I would support their organizational goals
College Level- Met with the Director of HR and Senior level management of the colleges I would support at the University
Interview Questions:
What is your work style?
Do you prefer to be an independent contributor or part of a larger team?
Situational interview questions i.e Give me an example of ....?

title: Assistant to the Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Cornell's website. Got a phone call and email for interview. Prepped by checking out university and dept's websites. Felt nervous going in but interviewers were nice and easy to make small talk with, which helped my nerves
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a year?

title: Foodservice Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: very casual interview, was offered job directly after the interview. They just wanted to know that I understood the job and could handle it. We met to interview a week after I submitted my application. Many of the questions were behavioral and about my past experiences that related to the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Student IT Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done in a meeting room with three supervisors (all in a different department). Each of them asked me questions about my work experience, campus involvement, and general interests. Always be sure to have at least 5 printed resumes with you when attending an interview. It's always a plus if you have a portfolio of your work, preferably in a nice folder or binder.
Interview Questions: Q: What projects have you worked on in the past?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online and got a short phone interview that lasted less than 30 minutes. Very casual. Focused on responsibilities, reason of applying...etc. Since a fellow student is the manager, it wasn't anything too serious or formal.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply?

title: Mechanical Engineer, for CHESS Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1)Phone interview
2) followed up with a phone conference with 3-4 people. However, 6-7 people attended.
3) I am actually not that far from the campus and offered to drive in, instead of doing a phone group interview. They refused the onsite interview, even though I was practically next door. No reason given, but seemed they were too lazy to meet with people face to face, even local candidates.  
4) They person leading the interview promised to follow up with all interviewers within a day or two to inform them of their candidacy.
Interview Questions:
1)Describe your work history.
2)You know this is a entry level position?
3)Asked how I dealt with supervisory or directing others?
4)Asked if I had any questions?
5)How soon can you start, looking to fill this position immediately?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: It was OK. There was no pressure, no difficult questions to answer. Friendly interviewer and good environment. Not very personal questions. They expect that you tell about your academic background, if it is strong in a specific research area, better for you.
Interview Questions: Previous experience.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing in the engineering school, I was flown to the campus (all expense paid) to conduct one-on-one interviews with the faculty. Very encouraging and a great experience. Other schools in Cornell apply a more competitive approach and bring students out prior to acceptance. The entire process gave me a sense of how the Ithaca community operated.
Interview Questions: What type of research I was considering or passionate about?

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email by the HR department at the business school after I applied for the position via the Cornell University jobs website. I was interviewed by phone first by the director, and then contacted to come in for an in-person interview. They put me up in a hotel and I was interviewed by a total of 6 people ranging from Vice Provost down to the Associate Director with whom I work on a team. All in all, the in-person interviews took about an hour and a half and all took place in the same location.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with businesses and how might you pitch the Johnson School of Business as a partner in recruitment and research to a private sector audience? What is your experience in fundraising? How would you leverage your background in nonprofits and government for this job?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: We first were asked questions in a group setting, then the interview group split into two and we had to collaborate with our respective teams to solve puzzles. After that we were split into groups of threes and went through a series of three interviews done by different hiring staff members of the job we were applying for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you faced adversity and had to overcome it.

title: Sloan Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: online interview which was average and turned out well, basic questions, and friendly behavior. The questions based on cover letter and resume. make sure you know what you wrote and specific sentences, do not fluff. Overall, the program is great and worth the wait time. Make sure you are not arrogant and sound genuine.
Interview Questions: why healthcare? Why cornell? how do you do in hard situations?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: A research presentation around 1 hr is required and then follow with the technical questions.  1 week later, I was asked for the reference letter.  After another one week, oral offer was received. The paperwork is very quick around 1 week. All the process is typical postdoc interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a postdoc

title: Studio Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Four people over the phone.  Impersonal, couldn't get a good feel for the people. Insisted I answer the, "Where do you see yourself in five years?" question. Didn't like that I don't know and am will to go with the flow.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult faculty.

title: Finance Specialist III - Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a 30 minute phone screening interview with the hiring manager and a human resources representative. The in-person interview lasted nearly three hours and was broken up into five separate smaller interviews. One of them consisted of actual customers that this position would serve; one consisted of two people in similar positions; one was with a human resource representative; one with the higher level administrator; and one with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a business problem that you have solved.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to contact professors yourself, introduce yourself, and wait to hear back. If they have a position available they'll call you in for a meeting and ask basic questions like why you're interested in the job and why you're qualified.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Account Representative IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview.  Received a phone setting up in person interview two weeks later.  Interviewed with HR and Director of department, tour the office building, interviewed with rest of department, then met with the director again.  Heard from employer two weeks later via email about job offer/decline.
Interview Questions: How would you look up reports?; How would you get co-workers involved in meeting that you are in charge of executing?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Since I got an A in the class so I am eligible to apply. I wrote an email to the professor and got the offer. The process is very smooth.
Interview Questions: There is no question

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took one week. I was interviewed by the professor who would give corresponding lecture for 30 minutes. The questions were designed to test my understanding on energy policy and energy security. Professor was very friendly, and we had a pleasure conversation.
Interview Questions: What do you know about energy policy? How do you find China's energy policy?

title: Student Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the positions with a letter of interest.  My lab got back to me by email.  I had a very short interview with them where I basically expressed my interest and we talked about the lab and my schedule and was offered the job by email later.  It was all very simple as the job trained people, so no prior experience was necessary.
Interview Questions: They were all expected

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions:
Do you enjoy high stress environments? This was for a high stress position. 

Provide code examples, etc.

They will call all of your references. They will check with your current employer. I did get a tour of the campus and a comprehensive benefits package.
Interview Questions: Write SQL QUERIES

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: The process is pretty routine, similar to other universities. After some months I was contacted through email by a professor and he said he would want to talk to me over the phone. He asked mostly about my research and why I am interested in Cornell University. Then he talked about his group at Cornell University.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Graduate Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to the interview, with a few possible dates floated to me. I was asked to prepare a presentation for the interview panel over what my plans were for the position. This presentation was the first part of the interview. Panelists asked questions afterwards. I was interviewed by different people from the department - a total of approx. 18 people in about 5 different sessions through the day.
Interview Questions: What are the specific plans you have for the program?

title: Cornell Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: all behavioral, not too much questions, I think I did alright, not too bad, no technical questions, the questions they asked related to the stuff you learn at school. Nice environment to interview, not too bad of a culture.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through the Cornell Student Job listings.
Got an email offering an interview to come into the lab director's office hours.
Very informal and easy-going. All behavioral questions as I was a freshman at the time.
Interview Questions:
Walk me through your resume?
Why an interest in (focus of lab)?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cornell University in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
just talk about the project that i have ever done, talk about the skills that I have
have a more detail explanation of the most interesting project,
how I apply skills to that particular project
Interview Questions: not really

title: Drafter III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Cornell University in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position of Drafter III with Cornell University in early April 2014 and was contacted by phone to set up an initial in person interview in early May 2014. I arrived at Newman Laboratory for an in person panel interview which consisted of myself and three other employees which included the hiring manager. The interview consisted of typical interview questions that were relevant to the position. The entire interview lasted approximately one hour. I wasn't given a tour of the laboratory or of any of the work areas. The next step in the process would have included a second interview. I knew that I was most likely on the short list for the first interview and was confident that my experience, education, and interview skills would lead to a second interview but it wasn't to be. I was contacted by the hiring manager by phone three weeks later to learn that I hadn't gotten the job.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult or unexpected.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straight-forward. Since I was an undergraduate at Cornell, the interview process was painless so I don't really have much to say. Just know the field you are applying to and be professional. Take the time to read research on the faculty or department you are going to be working for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cornell University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: a lot of questions it was ok it worked well interviewed by many people many days got the response the same day and accepted the offer one week after trip was payed by the university
Interview Questions: through resume

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cornell University
Interview Descriptions: Standard grad school application. Take the standardized tests (GRE and TOEFL), and submit letters of recommendation, transcripts, and statement of purpose. Unlike some schools there is no interview for the Computer Science department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Services Supervisor II Interview

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Typical academic process, which I think is quite stressful: 

1) Application package with CV, letter, references, research and teaching statement, writing samples.

2) Skype interview, about 45min, with the search committee, on standard questions. Why do you want to work here, what is your teaching experience, how can you contribute to the department, etc.

3) 2-day on-campus visit, with a 1h open seminar, a 1h talk on research and teaching plans with faculty only, lunch/dinners with  faculty, and 13 one-to-one 30 to 60-min interviews with faculty members and students.
Interview Questions: Suffice it to say that you should be able to answer technical questions at any point of the on-campus interviews, including dinners, after a couple of glasses of wine.

title: Research Support Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
It is difficult to get into the Cornell hiring system as an external candidate, but once you are within the system, you are given preferential treatment. Depending on your qualifications and background, you may be able to be promoted within a department or across colleges. 

As standard protocol, even if a department  considers you an ideal internal candidate, they will still need to post the position to the public and interview multiple candidates. 

The interview is conducted with select members of the employees you will most closely work with. This usually includes the internal HR contact, the project managers, and appropriate faculty members. The questions will go over the overall duties of the position as is expected within any position. They will also ask how you will handle specific problems or duties within the parameters of the job description. They may also ask questions regarding any additional skills you may have that can contribute to success within the position.
Interview Questions: Describe the publications you have contributed to and ways that you would assist the faculty in implementing their research

title: Fitness Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cornell University (Ithaca, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions:
There are two different interview experiences. There are "Bulks" during the beginning of the Fall Semester where they do three days of mass interviews, anyone that shows up gets an interview. Cornell Fitness Centers, CFC, does most of their hiring during this time. The other interview process happens during the year, when you submit an application and then schedule and appointment. 

Interviewers are usually other students that have been interview trained and have higher ranking, as well as students who are in assistant management positions. Occasionally you will be interviewed by the professional staff. The interviewer will take notes and complete an evaluation. The pro staff reviews all notes and recommendations and then makes the actual hiring decision.

Interview questions are very standard. They'll ask about yourself and then give scenario based questions. This may seem a little over board for a job at the gym but they're also doing  it as a growing experience for students. They want to give students as real of an experience on both sides of the interview process. That being said the interview may seem very daunting but they have realistic expectations especially for Freshmen who may never have had a job before. 

They're looking for you to have a personality more than anything. Stay calm, smile, and don't give one sentence answer. They're asking you a question, but think about what that question can reveal about your personality or customer service skills etc. Use every questions as an opportunity to sell yourself. Dress nicely, show up early.
Interview Questions:
To people who have never had a job or interview experience scenario based questions may seem a little strange or difficult to answer. 

Ex. Tell me a time you had to deal with a difficult person, Tell me a time you had to explain a new concept to someone. 

DON'T Give one sentence answers. Don't get caught up in explaining the situation, or complaining about the other person, they want to hear about you. YOU'RE the one being interviewed, so focus your answer on that. Talk about your process dealing with the situation being described in detail.

title: Graduate Student Interview
